revised_title: The Indigenous Status of the Sweet Chestnut Tree in England
tldr: In this letter, Daines Barrington discusses the indigenous status of the sweet chestnut tree in England. He provides evidence from his observations of chestnut plantations in Kent and compares them to the native growth of beech trees in Wales. Barrington argues that the sweet chestnut tree is not a native species and that it was likely introduced by planters.
